name: Temples of Boom Action Figure
description:
Digital custom action figure representation of a stoner masterpiece magnum opus. “Cypress Hill III: Temples of Boom” is the third studio album from the legendary east-side LA latino three-piece. It was released in 1995 as a follow up to their triple platinum commercial juggernaut “Black Sunday”. Although “Black Sunday” still remain as my personal favorite, “Temples of Boom” was a landmark in the group’s body of work as DJ Muggs start moving away from the original Cypress funky ‘latin lingo’ sound and into dark, slow, spooky, smokestacked beats. A specific style that the producer would later on perfected as his signature sound.This LP was also universally hailed as the group’s last great album, until they finally found their mojo back with “Elephants on Acid”... 23 years later.   

Card is made from Temples of Boom cover art.

Figure is made from Mondo’s Skeletor and Hasbro's Emperor Palpatine figure.

Bong is made from a 3 minutes google image search.
